title: [K-12] Blended Learning-Based Teaching Methods Workshop for Cell Biology: Integrated Science Inquiry and Language Instruction Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational biology knowledge and teaching experience, understanding of scientific terminology (core vocabulary related to cell biology), and pedagogical expression skills (clear explanations, concept connections)
context.additional_context: An activity-based blended learning program for pre-service/in-service teachers to strengthen cell biology pedagogy, integrating scientific inquiry processes (observation-question-hypothesis-experiment-conclusion) with language learning (terminology acquisition, report writing, presentations). Emphasizes strategies to simultaneously develop learners' reading comprehension (scientific text analysis) and expressive skills (experimental result documentation).

learning_goals: Learners will systematically explain core concepts of cell structure and function using the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis-experiment-analysis-conclusion) and specialized terminology (cell membrane, mitochondria, chloroplast, etc.)

Learners will design activity-based instructional methods in blended learning environments and creatively apply educational materials integrating learnersâ€™ reading/writing skills with scientific expressions (term definitions, lab report writing)

Teachers will design and implement three instructional strategies (visualization tools, step-by-step experiments, feedback routines) within one week to help elementary/middle school students (teens) understand the scientific thinking process (hypothesis formulation-experiment analysis-conclusion), improving their concept comprehension scores (5-point scale) to 3.5 or higher. Special emphasis is placed on evaluating lab report writing (structured text, scientific vocabulary) and science terminology proficiency (accuracy/contextuality)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
